locations.content_excerpt:
(k) Cyber Liability Insurance. The Company shall have bound a cyber liability insurance
policy with:
    (i) Coverage limits of not less than $10,000,000 per occurrence and $10,000,000
    aggregate;
...

the Company's systems, networks, or data (whether occurring before or after Closing) that:
  (i) Triggers notification obligations under Regulation S-P, state breach notification laws,
  or contractua...
locations.full_paragraph:
the Company's systems, networks, or data (whether occurring before or after Closing) that:
  (i) Triggers notification obligations under Regulation S-P, state breach notification laws,
  or contractual notification obligations to clients/custodians; OR
  (ii) Results in losses exceeding $500,000 (including breach response costs, regulatory fines,
  litigation defense/settlement, business interruption).

locations.content_excerpt:
If a Cyber Incident is reported during the escrow period, the full $5,000,000 shall remain in
escrow until the incident is fully resolved (all breach response costs incurred, all litigation
settled or...
locations.full_paragraph:
If a Cyber Incident is reported during the escrow period, the full $5,000,000 shall remain in
escrow until the incident is fully resolved (all breach response costs incurred, all litigation
settled or adjudicated, all regulatory proceedings concluded), at which time any remaining funds
(after satisfaction of Buyer's indemnification claims under Section 8.7) shall be released to
Seller.
```

locations.content_excerpt:
**Representation (Article III, Section 3.14(b) — Adequate Insurance):**
```
Seller represents and warrants that:
(b) The errors and omissions professional liability insurance maintained by the Company...
locations.full_paragraph:
**Representation (Article III, Section 3.14(b) — Adequate Insurance):**
```
Seller represents and warrants that:
(b) The errors and omissions professional liability insurance maintained by the Company has
limits of not less than $30 million per claim and $60 million aggregate, and such limits are
adequate and customary for registered investment advisers managing $42.5 billion in assets
under management. Schedule 3.14(b) sets forth:
    (i) A list of all claims made against the E&O policy in the past 10 years, including
    claim amounts, settlement amounts, and reserves established by the insurer;
    (ii) A list of all circumstances known to the Company that could reasonably be expected
    to result in an E&O claim exceeding $5 million;
    (iii) Confirmation that the E&O policy includes coverage for SEC/FINRA/state securities
    regulator defense costs, and such coverage is "defense outside limits" (defense costs do
    not erode policy limits).

locations.content_excerpt:
Buyer shall provide Seller with prompt notice (within 10 business days) of any DOL or IRS inquiry,
examination notice, or proposed assessment related to prohibited transactions. Seller shall have
the ...
locations.full_paragraph:
Buyer shall provide Seller with prompt notice (within 10 business days) of any DOL or IRS inquiry,
examination notice, or proposed assessment related to prohibited transactions. Seller shall have
the right (but not the obligation) to control the defense of any such matter, provided Seller
acknowledges in writing its indemnification obligation under this Section 8.10.
```
